summary: The concept of "support grant," redirected to "aid to undertakings," pertains to EU economic policy aimed at fostering the competitiveness of businesses. Such aid can elicit positive outcomes for independent entrepreneurs and established firms alike, although it may also risk distorsion of market dynamics. The legal framework adheres to stringent regulations to ensure that grants do not entrench unfair advantages among beneficiaries. In contexts like konkursverfahren, businesses in distress may receive aid to facilitate repaying debts and restructuring. The Europeanization of these policies promotes internationalization, benefiting sectors like maschinenfabrik and möbelwerke, while ensuring compliance with economic standards across member states.
